frame.name: Cognitive_connection
frame.definition:
<def-root>A concept, <fen>Concept_1</fen>, is related causally or collocationally to another concept, <fen>Concept_2</fen> by means of some evidence. They may be related only under certain <fen>Circumstances</fen> or from a certain <fen>Point_of_view</fen>. The two concepts may be expressed collectively as associated <fen>Concepts</fen>. Any cognizer is deprofiled.
<ex><fex name="Concept_1">Smoking</fex> is <t>tied</t> <fex name="Concept_2">to cancer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Concept_1
FE.definition: <def-root>The concept which is linked to <fen>Concept_2</fen>. Generally expressed as the external argument. <ex><fex name="C1">Smoking</fex> is <t>tied</t> to cancer.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Concept_2
FE.definition: <def-root>The concept which is tied to <fen>Concept_1</fen>. Generally expressed as a PP complement. <ex>Smoking is <t>tied</t> <fex name="C2">to cancer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Point_of_view
FE.definition: <def-root>The point of view from which the connection exists. <ex>Smoking is <t>linked</t> to cancer <fex name="POV">in his mind</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the connection exists.
<ex><fex name="Circumstances">In the lab</fex>, a person's weight and life expectancy are strongly <t>connected</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Concepts
FE.definition: <def-root>The two concepts expressed jointly. <ex><fex name="Cs">Smoking and weight gain</fex> are <t>connected</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> of connection between the <fen>Concepts</fen>. <ex>These two incidents are <fex name="Deg">closely</fex> <t>linked</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Specification
FE.definition: <def-root>A further specification on the linkage. <ex>These two concepts are <fex name="Spec">innately</fex> <t>connected</t>.</ex> <ex>Smoking and lung cancer are <t>linked</t> <fex name="Spec">in some unknown way</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: linked.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having a relationship or connection between people or things

lexUnit.name: tied.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: related to in some respect.

lexUnit.name: connected.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: being related in some respect

lexUnit.name: related.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: connotated or connected; reminding of

lexUnit.name: associated.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: closely related in the mind

lexUnit.name: relationship.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the way in which two or more people or things are connected, or the state of being connected.

lexUnit.name: identify with.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Experience a mental connection with something.
